1: <sup>1</sup> I will love thee, O LORD, my strength.
2: <sup>2</sup> The LORD is my rock, and my fortress, and my deliverer; my God, my strength, in whom I will trust; my buckler, and the horn of my salvation, and my high tower.
3: <sup>3</sup> I will call upon the LORD, who is worthy to be praised: so shall I be saved from mine enemies.
4: <sup>4</sup> The sorrows of death compassed me, and the floods of ungodly men made me afraid.
5: <sup>5</sup> The sorrows of hell compassed me about: the snares of death prevented me.
6: <sup>6</sup> In my distress I called upon the LORD, and cried unto my God: he heard my voice out of his temple, and my cry came before him, even into his ears.
7: <sup>7</sup> Then the earth shook and trembled; the foundations also of the hills moved and were shaken, because he was wroth.
8: <sup>8</sup> There went up a smoke out of his nostrils, and fire out of his mouth devoured: coals were kindled by it.
9: <sup>9</sup> He bowed the heavens also, and came down: and darkness was under his feet.
10: <sup>10</sup> And he rode upon a cherub, and did fly: yea, he did fly upon the wings of the wind.
11: <sup>11</sup> He made darkness his secret place; his pavilion round about him were dark waters and thick clouds of the skies.
12: <sup>12</sup> At the brightness that was before him his thick clouds passed, hail stones and coals of fire.
13: <sup>13</sup> The LORD also thundered in the heavens, and the Highest gave his voice; hail stones and coals of fire.
14: <sup>14</sup> Yea, he sent out his arrows, and scattered them; and he shot out lightnings, and discomfited them.
15: <sup>15</sup> Then the channels of waters were seen, and the foundations of the world were discovered at thy rebuke, O LORD, at the blast of the breath of thy nostrils.
16: <sup>16</sup> He sent from above, he took me, he drew me out of many waters.
17: <sup>17</sup> He delivered me from my strong enemy, and from them which hated me: for they were too strong for me.
18: <sup>18</sup> They prevented me in the day of my calamity: but the LORD was my stay.
19: <sup>19</sup> He brought me forth also into a large place; he delivered me, because he delighted in me.
20: <sup>20</sup> The LORD rewarded me according to my righteousness; according to the cleanness of my hands hath he recompensed me.
21: <sup>21</sup> For I have kept the ways of the LORD, and have not wickedly departed from my God.
22: <sup>22</sup> For all his judgments were before me, and I did not put away his statutes from me.
23: <sup>23</sup> I was also upright before him, and I kept myself from mine iniquity.
24: <sup>24</sup> Therefore hath the LORD recompensed me according to my righteousness, according to the cleanness of my hands in his eyesight.
25: <sup>25</sup> With the merciful thou wilt shew thyself merciful; with an upright man thou wilt shew thyself upright;
26: <sup>26</sup> With the pure thou wilt shew thyself pure; and with the froward thou wilt shew thyself froward.
27: <sup>27</sup> For thou wilt save the afflicted people; but wilt bring down high looks.
28: <sup>28</sup> For thou wilt light my candle: the LORD my God will enlighten my darkness.
29: <sup>29</sup> For by thee I have run through a troop; and by my God have I leaped over a wall.
30: <sup>30</sup> As for God, his way is perfect: the word of the LORD is tried: he is a buckler to all those that trust in him.
31: <sup>31</sup> For who is God save the LORD? or who is a rock save our God?
32: <sup>32</sup> It is God that girdeth me with strength, and maketh my way perfect.
33: <sup>33</sup> He maketh my feet like hinds’ feet, and setteth me upon my high places.
34: <sup>34</sup> He teacheth my hands to war, so that a bow of steel is broken by mine arms.
35: <sup>35</sup> Thou hast also given me the shield of thy salvation: and thy right hand hath holden me up, and thy gentleness hath made me great.
36: <sup>36</sup> Thou hast enlarged my steps under me, that my feet did not slip.
37: <sup>37</sup> I have pursued mine enemies, and overtaken them: neither did I turn again till they were consumed.
38: <sup>38</sup> I have wounded them that they were not able to rise: they are fallen under my feet.
39: <sup>39</sup> For thou hast girded me with strength unto the battle: thou hast subdued under me those that rose up against me.
40: <sup>40</sup> Thou hast also given me the necks of mine enemies; that I might destroy them that hate me.
41: <sup>41</sup> They cried, but there was none to save them: even unto the LORD, but he answered them not.
42: <sup>42</sup> Then did I beat them small as the dust before the wind: I did cast them out as the dirt in the streets.
43: <sup>43</sup> Thou hast delivered me from the strivings of the people; and thou hast made me the head of the heathen: a people whom I have not known shall serve me.
44: <sup>44</sup> As soon as they hear of me, they shall obey me: the strangers shall submit themselves unto me.
45: <sup>45</sup> The strangers shall fade away, and be afraid out of their close places.
46: <sup>46</sup> The LORD liveth; and blessed be my rock; and let the God of my salvation be exalted.
47: <sup>47</sup> It is God that avengeth me, and subdueth the people under me.
48: <sup>48</sup> He delivereth me from mine enemies: yea, thou liftest me up above those that rise up against me: thou hast delivered me from the violent man.
49: <sup>49</sup> Therefore will I give thanks unto thee, O LORD, among the heathen, and sing praises unto thy name.
50: <sup>50</sup> Great deliverance giveth he to his king; and sheweth mercy to his anointed, to David, and to his seed for evermore.
